Presenting Complaints (Symptoms):
Presenting Symptoms: Substance use
Chief complaints:
1) Unable to quite substance use
2) Low motivation
3) Feels guilty to when avoids friends
Current Mental Status Examination: General appearance & behavior: Dull; Speech: Low, Mood & Affect: depressed, Thought, Perception, Cognitive functions: Normal; Judgement and Insight: Judgement is affected little bit and insight is intact.
Psychotherapy Technique: Supportive, cognitive restructuring, problem solving and reflective listening.
Issues discussed in Current Session:
There are few issues discussed in the session:
1) Substance use: Patient discussed about the problem facing in reducing marijuana usage. He feels a correlation between not exercising and increased marijuana use, attributing it to seeking alternative activities. 
2) Guilt: He feels difficulty in avoiding friends who use marijuana to prevent hurting them which lead to increase his substance usage.
3) Alternative activities: Patient is hesitant in reconnecting with friends who don't smoke pot, but he accepts the advantages of engaging in healthier activities with them. He wants to have low-commitment pet like a snake or fish as an alternative to a dog.
4)Willing to change: Patient joined one meeting earlier but felt disconnected from the group. Although, he acknowledges the potential benefits of relating to others in similar situations and being part of a team.
5) Action Plan: He is willing to try out two different support groups, motivated by the analogy of being part of a team. He rated the current session 8 out of 10 score which proves that he is motivated to bring change in himself.
Action Plan: Advised to indulge in healthier activities, navigating social relationships, considering alternative commitments, and to join a support group as a team where he can find people like him.
